ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Virtual seminar on zoom
None

The class was scheduled to meet 3 times a week (MWF) and on Friday's class (different from the other two days) we either had an asynchronous assignment or a meeting with our group for the semester long project we were working on.
Linguameeting sessions, Individual oral exam
In addition to the virtual discussion-based classes, students also took part in virtual one-on-one speaking sessions with language coaches via LinguaMeeting.

canvas quizzes
online activities
Spanish novel
outside spanish speaking trainer
essays
in class debates
presentations
quizlet

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course allowed me to improve my speaking skills in Spanish more than I thought possible. We also focused on grammar, critical thinking (through readings), and cultural knowledge.
I gained a lot of confidence in speaking Spanish as well as a lot of writing practice which was very helpful.
I brushed up on my spanish grammar, and I learned a lot more about writing/reading
My Spanish greatly improved!

I developed my skill and confidence with unscripted Spanish speaking and discussion of advanced subjects, and I improved my familiarity with advanced grammatical forms. I also did more advanced Spanish-language research into real-world subjects in Latin America, and increased my familiarity with literary Spanish.

spanish grammar
better spanish speaking abilities in terms of fluency
increased variety of grammar/sentence structures in writing
vocabulary to talk about a variety of salient topics (i.e. immigration, climate change, social justice, etc.)
My Spanish grammar, speaking, and writing has definitely improved! I feel much more confident in my Spanish now than I did before taking the course.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The course was super interactive and engaging. I cannot think of a weakness. It always kept me thinking and on my feet - there was never a dull moment.

The strengths of this course were the really detailed feedback we received on almost all assignments, as well as the volume of low-pressure practice we got both writing and speaking Spanish. One weakness of this course was the grammar and vocabulary exercises. Even though they were not the focus of the course, I didn't feel I was getting a lot out of them and they weren't super helpful for the tests covering them.

Strengths -- I learned a lot from just speaking and writing more. I also loved the Linguameeting sessions
Weaknesses -- I think there should be more opportunities to receive individual writing feedback (with line edits)
The engagement was more than perfect. I couldnt ask for a more involved and balanced class.
I wish there was more emphasis on grammar

The course was definitely geared towards Spanish improvement! The class was very interactive and we never stayed on the same topic for too long. However, this also had its shortcomings because there was rarely a chance to engage in in-depth discussions.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I loved the blog project in this course because it helped to foster a sense of community which was especially needed during this time of COVID-19. The group presentations on the novela also served the same purpose, along with the breakout room discussions with peers. By the end, I felt super comfortable talking to any of my peers in class. The Linguameetings were also super great - I think they helped my language growth a ton and they were also super fun.
I really appreciated having one day of the course be asynchronous given the very real problem of zoom fatigue. I think Professor Vazquez did a really good job of having an engaging virtual course.
I liked the variety of online activities and in class discussions/presentations
With the various group projects and presentations, this class managed to make the engagement a priority.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student. I came in thinking that my Spanish level had already reached its peak and it was only a matter of maintaining what I already knew. I was so wrong. My Spanish improved more than I thought was possible. I am now so much more confident speaking and communicating in Spanish.
YES! Amazing class.

I would! It is a great course to practice and improve your Spanish and if you need can get your language credit with an L5 Spanish course, I found this one to be very low-pressure and not have the overwhelming nature of most language courses at Yale.
Yes, but I think the course structure overall is better suited for in-person format
Yes but only very dedicated students.
Yes, I found this course an excellent and broad exploration of higher-level Spanish.
yeah, I feel like I've gotten much better at spanish
Yes! Take this class if you wish to see improvement in your Spanish skills.
